meanings.definition: Of or relating to the elbow.
meanings.sent1: She felt a sharp pain in her cubital joint after lifting the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined his cubital region to check for any signs of injury.
meanings.sent3: When he tried to dance, his cubital movements were so awkward that everyone laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her cubital embrace was a comforting gesture after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The cubital angle of the door made it difficult to open with one hand.

meanings.sent1: The nurse carefully inserted the needle into the patient's cubital for the blood test.
meanings.sent2: He could see the bulging cubital on his arm after the workout.
meanings.sent3: The cubital seemed to have a mind of its own, throbbing rhythmically.
meanings.sent4: The cubital carried the life-sustaining blood throughout his body.
meanings.sent5: She winced as the doctor tied the tourniquet around her cubital for the blood draw.
